system.description:
Lords are chosen by their merit and their might. Even if they come from a long line of kings, if they cannot supply the required righteousness or violence, then they will be taken over by that which deserves it more. Most Lords are on the Path of Glory, fighting and inflicting violence to ensure peace for their family (that is, their entire banwa) as well as to perform great feats of excellence that will cause them to be remembered.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Cleave. Attack all enemies in blast 2 with Bravery, and then an ally in burst 2 may move 2.

Gambits [[/r d10]]

1-3: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

4-6: Rush > Chant [1]: This fighter and all allies in burst 3 gains +2d on their next attack > Inflict Violence

7-9: Rush > Rousing Speech [2]: All allies in burst 3 gain Overwhelming and Skewering on their next attack with Bravery.

10: Rush > Ha! Show Me What You Can Do! [2]: Two different allies in burst 10 may inflict violence.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: It's Time To Raid!
traits.description: At the beginning of a Resound, the Gatusan fighters choose a single enemy in the field as their Raid Target. All their attacks against the Raid Target gain Overwhelming. If that enemy is brought to 0 HP, all Gatusan fighters in the field can heal 2 and move 2.

traits.name: Come! Let Us Break The Sea Together!
traits.description: When the Lord starts their riff, all allies may move 2. All enemies in burst 2 of the Lord cannot be forcibly moved.
